title: Interfacial Tension Data Schema
description: Interfacial tension tests measure the interfacial tension between two phases. These are labelled the wetting phase and the non-wetting phase. A surfactant can also be defined. Each test step reports the interfacial tension and optionally, the surfactant concentration.

TestNumber.title: Test Number
TestNumber.description: A number for this test for purposes of e.g., tracking lab sequence.

WettingPhaseTypeID.title: Wetting Phase Type ID
WettingPhaseTypeID.description: The phase that adheres more strongly to the solid surface, typically a liquid in contact with a solid in interfacial tension tests.

NonWettingPhaseTypeID.title: Non Wetting Phase Type ID
NonWettingPhaseTypeID.description: The phase that interacts less with the surface and is displaced by the wetting phase, often a gas or immiscible liquid.

Surfactants.title: Surfactants
Surfactants.description: Substances added to reduce the interfacial tension between the wetting and non-wetting phases.

items.title: Surfactants
items.description: Substances added to reduce the interfacial tension between the wetting and non-wetting phases.

SurfactantName.title: Surfactant Name
SurfactantName.description: The name of the surfactant component used in the test to modify interfacial tension.

MassFraction.title: Mass Fraction
MassFraction.description: The proportion of the surfactant by mass relative to the total mass of the mixture in the test.

MoleFraction.title: Mole Fraction
MoleFraction.description: The proportion of the surfactant by moles relative to the total moles of components in the mixture.
MoleFraction.x-osdu-frame-of-reference: UOM:amount of substance per amount of substance
